activities.name: Informed consent
activities.description: Informed consent from the participant or the participant's legal guardian MUST be obtained prior to any study-related procedures.

activities.name: Demographics
activities.description: Demographics include sex, race, ethnicity, and date of birth.

activities.name: Medical, surgical, and hemophilia history
activities.description: Includes hemophilia history assessment of disease severity, blood type, and Rh factor.

activities.name: Genotype
activities.description: Collection of samples for genotype analysis.

activities.name: Vital signs
activities.description: Vital signs include blood pressure, pulse rate, respiratory rate, and temperature.

activities.name: HIV, HBV, and HCV status
activities.description: Viral testing performed at a central laboratory.

activities.name: CD4 count, viral load
activities.description: For participants known to be HIV antibody positive.

activities.name: Hematology
activities.description: Hematology parameters include RBC, WBC, platelet count, Hgb, and Hct.

activities.name: Coagulation parameters
activities.description: Coagulation parameters include activated partial thromboplastin time (aPTT).

activities.name: von Willebrand Comprehensive Panel
activities.description: Includes assessments of VWF ristocetin cofactor activity and VWF antigen.

activities.name: Nijmegen-modified Bethesda assay (inhibitor assay)
activities.description: Inhibitor assay performed by central laboratory.

activities.name: Physician's global assessment of response to treatment (PGA)
activities.description: Physician's global assessment of response to treatment (PGA)

activities.name: Ultrasound joint assessments
activities.description: Anatomical structural joint-health assessment via ultrasound imaging.

activities.name: Electronic patient diary (ePD) training / administration/ review
Abbreviated pharmacokinetic Sampling
activities.description: Abbreviated PK sampling after first dose.

activities.name: Sequential pharmacokinetic sampling
activities.description: Extensive PK sampling at Baseline and Week 26.

activities.name: PROMIS Assessments
activities.description: PROMIS Assessments to include Pain Intensity, Pain Interference, and Physical Function.

activities.name: Haem-A-QoL (≥17 years old) or Haemo QoL (<17 years old)
HAL (≥18 years old) or pedHAL (<18 years old)
Patient Global Impression of Severity (activity and joint)
Exit interview
activities.description: Interviews conducted with a subset of participants.

notes.text: a. Screening may be accomplished over the course of more than 1 study visit if needed.
b. Washout prior to BIVV001 Day 1 dose administration is at least 96 hours (4 days) if the participant is receiving a conventional FVIII product.
c. Participants should schedule their study visits to be 7 ±1 day after the previous prophylactic dose of BIVV001.
d. At this visit, participants in Arm B (on-demand treatment) switch to prophylaxis.
e. Unscheduled visits may be necessary during the study to repeat any blood sampling if required.
f. This call or visit will occur 14 (+7) days after the last dose of BIVV001.
g. Informed consent from the participant or the participant's legal guardian MUST be obtained prior to any study-related procedures.

activityGroups.name: Safety
activityNames: Prior and concomitant medications and concomitant therapies and procedures

activityGroups.name: Efficacy
activityNames: Physician's global assessment of response to treatment (PGA)
Investigator's assessment of participant's response to treatment of bleeding episodes treated at the study site
Electronic patient diary (ePD) training / administration/ review
Participant's completion of ePD including at-home dosing, bleeding episodes, and assessment of response to treatment of bleeding episodes

activityGroups.name: Participant-Reported Outcomes
activityNames: Haem-A-QoL (≥17 years old) or Haemo QoL (<17 years old)
HAL (≥18 years old) or pedHAL (<18 years old)
Patient Global Impression of Severity (activity and joint)
